channel.title: Completionist Cape
channel.description: Ok well ive tried to add completionist cape...First when i tried to spawn it it said item id does not exist...So i changed the item id of 1031 to the completionist cape..Now when i spawn 1031 it gives me the same old cape that was there before....Any help please?

item.title: Completionist Cape
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

anyone got skype or sumthing they can help me on?

Read full topic

item.title: Completionist Cape
item.dc:creator: @T_h_3 T h 3
item.description:
@T_h_3 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:471242”][quote author=T h 3 link=topic=588780.msg4174235#msg4174235 date=1354767904]

how do i make sure im loading the new cache?

If you added it to your current cache. There is no ‘new’ cache. Don’t listen to that kid, he’s a post count whore.

private final int VERSION = (This is the old version); // Version of cache
Just change that number +1 in your Cachedownloader.java client sided.

Not sure what the other guys on about, hope this fixes your problem.
[/quote]
love dude you are seriously stupid.
If he edited the live cache (I.e the cache currently in his C:\ drive, assuming that’s where it is saved to) he doesn’t need to edit the cache version. The ONLY time you edit the cache version in the cachedownloader, is if you need everyone to redownload the cache if they are playing on, lets say, a webclient.
those Main_file cache files, are added whether you have the real cache or not. They can be auto generated by the client. Don’t believe me? delete them and start up a client.[/quote]
main_file_cache.dat is where the changes need to take place. If you edit them then add it back to the cache it will work for a corrupt cache, Ofc it will be auto generated from the client IF ALL THE OTHER FILES ARE ALREADY THERE…THUS THE REASON FOR EDITING IT IN A DIFFERENT FOLDER…

From the information I read I thought best for him to change the cache version to make his client reload the whole cache…

Seriously get off my cock man i’m just trying to help someone

Read full topic

item.title: Completionist Cape
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“T h 3, post:11, topic:471242”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=588780.msg4174220#msg4174220 date=1354767038]

how do i make sure im loading the new cache?

If you added it to your current cache. There is no ‘new’ cache. Don’t listen to that kid, he’s a post count whore.
[/quote]
private final int VERSION = (This is the old version); // Version of cache
Just change that number +1 in your Cachedownloader.java client sided.

Not sure what the other guys on about, hope this fixes your problem.[/quote]
Fuck dude you are seriously stupid.
If he edited the live cache (I.e the cache currently in his C:\ drive, assuming that’s where it is saved to) he doesn’t need to edit the cache version. The ONLY time you edit the cache version in the cachedownloader, is if you need everyone to redownload the cache if they are playing on, lets say, a webclient.
those Main_file cache files, are added whether you have the real cache or not. They can be auto generated by the client. Don’t believe me? delete them and start up a client.

Read full topic

item.title: Completionist Cape
item.dc:creator: @T_h_3 T h 3
item.description:
@T_h_3 wrote:

If your using toms cache suite try opening a new folder and add the Main_file parts of your cache to it. and pack that folder. Then re add it to your cache.

Some PI caches are corrupted when released and you have to “rig” them in…

Read full topic

item.title: Completionist Cape
item.dc:creator: @T_h_3 T h 3
item.description:
@T_h_3 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:471242”][quote author=Host Gushers link=topic=588780.msg4174215#msg4174215 date=1354766832]
how do i make sure im loading the new cache?
[/quote]
If you added it to your current cache. There is no ‘new’ cache. Don’t listen to that kid, he’s a post count whore.[/quote]
private final int VERSION = (This is the old version); // Version of cache
Just change that number +1 in your Cachedownloader.java client sided.

Not sure what the other guys on about, hope this fixes your problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Completionist Cape
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. this is client sided.
  2. Make sure to add the model into the “raw” folder of your cache. Make sure all the itemdef ints are correct, and it’s easiest if you set it to a item id that hasn’t been used already. Say 15k+

Read full topic

item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

i am using trisidiaX and well i did do everything right…I added models in cache/raw and added ints in item def.java and item in item.cfg.
